description: go/build: document GOOS.go also has implicit GOOS build constraint

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/

https://codereview.appspot.com/9064044/diff/5001/src/pkg/go/build/doc.go
File src/pkg/go/build/doc.go (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/9064044/diff/5001/src/pkg/go/build/doc.go#newcode100
src/pkg/go/build/doc.go:100: // matches GOOS, GOARCH, *_GOOS, *_GOARCH, or *_GOOS_GOARCH for any known operating
this is hard to read now, with all these cases.
how about
matches any of the patterns
   *_GOOS
   *_GOARCH
   * _GOOS_GOARCH
(example: source_windows_amd64.go) or the literal
   GOOS
   GOARCH
(example: windows.go) then ...

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, i.caught.air@gmail.com, alexb@frankandoak.com, r@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

https://codereview.appspot.com/9064044/diff/17001/src/pkg/go/build/doc.go
File src/pkg/go/build/doc.go (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/9064044/diff/17001/src/pkg/go/build/doc.go#newcode100
src/pkg/go/build/doc.go:100: // matches any of the following pattens:
s/pattens/patterns/

https://codereview.appspot.com/9064044/diff/17001/src/pkg/go/build/doc.go#newcode104
src/pkg/go/build/doc.go:104: // (example: source_windows_amd64.go) or the literal:
s/literal/literals/

https://codereview.appspot.com/9064044/diff/17001/src/pkg/go/build/doc.go#newcode107
src/pkg/go/build/doc.go:107: // (example: windows.go) where GOOS and GOARCH represents any known operating
s/represents/represent/

https://codereview.appspot.com/9064044/diff/17001/src/pkg/go/build/doc.go#newcode110
src/pkg/go/build/doc.go:110: // those terms.
refold the lines please

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=8cca28e940ea ***

go/build: document GOOS.go also has implicit GOOS build constraint

R=golang-dev, i.caught.air, alexb, r
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/9064044

subject: code review 9064044: go/build: document GOOS.go also has implicit GOOS build...
